text: Discover a rare opportunity to own over 7 acres of versatile land in the peaceful rural community of Fort Thomas, Arizona. Conveniently located a short distance from Highway 70 and within close proximity to the local school and post office, this spacious property offers both accessibility and seclusion.
formatted_address: W Hinton Rd, Fort Thomas, AZ, 85536

text: Offering a foundation to Develop; an RV Park, Tiny Home Village, or Intentional Community. This 3.71-acre property is primed for a high-demand residential or lifestyle project. The seller's initial county consultation provides a clear roadmap for permitting, giving you a massive head start on your due diligence. Major infrastructure IS ALREADY IN PLACE, offering a distinct advantage for any development model:12 Sites w/ Water Hookups: The backbone for a profitable Tiny Home Village, an RV park, or a community co-op. 4-BR Septic & Build Pad: Ready for a primary residence, a manager's home, or a central community center.10kW Solar System: Dramatically reduces operational costs for a rental business or supports a sustainable community vision. RARE 3-Source Water: A well, valuable irrigation rights, and city water secure the long-term value and resilience of the investment. A functional tiny home serves as an immediate rental, a manager's unit, or a founder's cottage. The established 150-tree orchard adds an agri-business element or a farm-to-table lifestyle. This is a rare, flexible foundation for a savvy investor or a community visionary. Buyer to verify all permitting detail.
formatted_address: 13915 N US Highway 70, Fort Thomas, AZ, 85536

text: This 3 1/2 Acre Parcel Provides Stunning Panoramic Views! Glorious Sunrises! Breathtaking Sunsets! You will also enjoy Dazzling Starlit Skies! The relatively level topography makes the entire parcel more usable. Plenty of space here for: Horses, Chickens, Trees, Gardens, Toys, and all your necessary Out Buildings. And... there's Room to spare for Canines and Kiddos to run free! This parcel is accessed via an easement a short distance (450 ft) from the paved Black Rock Road. An added bonus... all utilities are nearby. With a few visits to the local eatery and shop ''Megs Place'' you may meet many of the wonderful people who live in this small community. Call today for your tour of this beautiful property.
formatted_address: Black Rock Rd, Fort Thomas, AZ, 85536

text: THE PERFECT SPOT TO BUILD YOUR DREAM! 3.62 acres in Fort Thomas, AZ with panoramic sunrise and sunset views. The property sits partially on a hilltop, giving you some of the best scenery in the valley. Natural gas and water are available at the property line and electrical lines are already on-site for easy hookup. A great location to build your home or retreat with wide-open skies and endless possibilities. Property boundaries shown on parcel map photo may not be an exact representation.
formatted_address: N Desert Sage Rd, Fort Thomas, AZ, 85536

text: This beautiful +/- 436-acre property near Fort Thomas in Graham County, Arizona offers tremendous potential for a variety of agricultural and commercial uses. Located in the fertile Pueblo and Gila Valley river bottom, the land is surrounded by the scenic Pinaleno, Nantanes, and Gila Mountains, offering breathtaking views and a peaceful, rural setting. Priced at just $5,560 per acre, this is an exceptional opportunity for growers, dairies, or feedlot operators looking to relocate or expand operations from the Phoenix area. The property's agricultural history includes successful crops such as mums, pansies, and tomatoes, and it is well-suited for most above-ground vegetable farming. It previously housed an 80,000-square-foot hydroponic greenhouse used for growing tomatoes and other... crops like hemp. The land also features approximately 90 acres of former cotton fields that have been lifted, leveled, and bank-protected, making them ideal for repurposing as pasture or for other farm-related operations. A former tree farm with roughly 20 acres of mature Eldarica (Afghan) pines remains intact and may be included in the sale. Power is provided by Gila River Co-op, with electricity running through the property. Water resources are robust, with reported water depths of around 40 feet and flow rates of up to 700 gallons per minute. The land falls within the Gila Valley Irrigation District, which includes eight agricultural wells supported by a 5,000-gallon holding tank and pressure tank, delivering approximately six acre-feet per acre for 78 acres of irrigated farmland. The remaining land allows for up to twelve additional permitted domestic wells producing about 35 gallons per minute each. Portions of the property also have underground irrigation systems in place. Access is convenient, with highway frontage along Highway 70 offering excellent visibility and a paved entrance. The front 20 acres are currently in the process of being rezoned for an RV park, adding potential income for a future owner. The land also borders BLM land and includes frontage along the Gila River, further enhancing its appeal. While commercial in-ground farming is not allowed, in-ground use for personal agricultural activities is permitted. All above-ground farming remains fully allowed. Located near Safford, Arizona, the property offers easy access to essential amenities such as groceries, healthcare, and retail. The nearby San Carlos Indian Reservation provides recreational opportunities like fishing, hunting, camping, and visits to San Carlos Lake. Additionally, Mt. Graham is just a short drive away, offering a quick escape to cooler temperatures and high-elevation aspen forests. The property is currently partially used as a staging area for a drywall composting business, but all materials and debris will be removed prior to closing. The seller is open to selling the entire parcel or dividing it into smaller sections, and seller financing is available. A detailed marketing brochure and a copy of the water agreement with the Gila Valley Irrigation District are available upon request. This is a unique and versatile piece of real estate with strong agricultural infrastructure, scenic surroundings, and promising development possibilities. It's an excellent buy for any serious grower, agribusiness, or investor looking for a well-located, water-rich property in eastern Arizona. Contact the broker for more details and to request the full marketing package.
